HOME.TITLE: Home
HOME.SUBTITLE: A powerful, open-source Identity and Access Management solution for modern applications.
HOME.FEATURES_SUBTITLE: Everything you need for secure authentication and authorization
HOME.LIBRARY_DESC_1: KeyCloak Library simplifies authentication and authorization by providing easy-to-use method calls instead of complex REST API integration and configuration.
HOME.LIBRARY_DESC_2: Handle login, user management, role assignment, and token handling with minimal boilerplate code.
HOME.CONFIGURE_ONCE: Just configure once, then call methods.
HOME.INTEGRATION_DESC: This application is ready for Keycloak integration. Follow these simple steps to get up and running:
HOME.STEP_1_DESC: Set up a Keycloak server or use a managed service
HOME.STEP_3_DESC: Add authentication guards on protected routes

FUNCTIONS.LOGIN_DESC: Log in user and receive tokens
FUNCTIONS.INTROSPECTTOKEN_DESC: Check if token is still valid
FUNCTIONS.USERHASCLIENTROLE_DESC: Check if user has client role
FUNCTIONS.GETREALMROLESOFUSER_DESC: Get all realm roles assigned to user
FUNCTIONS.GETCLIENTROLESOFUSER_DESC: Get all client roles of user

API_DOC.TITLE: API Documentation
API_DOC.SUBTITLE: Detailed guide on all Keycloak Library Functions
API_DOC.SELECT_FUNCTION: Select a function from the list on the side
API_DOC.VIEW_DETAILS: View details, parameters, code examples, and best practices

SETUP.TITLE: Setup Guide
SETUP.STEP_1_DESC: Prepare the environment to using Keycloak library
SETUP.STEP_2_DETAILS_3: mvn clean install -DskipTests (to build Keycloak Library)
SETUP.STEP_2_DETAILS_4: Library will be installed to local Maven repository
SETUP.STEP_3_DESC: Install Keycloak Library into Spring Boot project
SETUP.STEP_3_DETAILS_3: Library will be imported to classpath
SETUP.STEP_4_DESC: Setup Keycloak Server and Configure Admin Console
SETUP.STEP_4_DETAILS_1: Pull Docker image: docker pull quay.io/keycloak/keycloak:latest
SETUP.STEP_4_DETAILS_2: Run Keycloak: docker run -p 8080:8080 -e KEYCLOAK_ADMIN=admin -e KEYCLOAK_ADMIN_PASSWORD=admin quay.io/keycloak/keycloak:latest start-dev
SETUP.STEP_4_DETAILS_5: Create Realm: Click "Manage realms" > Click "Create realm" > Enter name (e.g., ApplicationRealm) > Click "Create"
SETUP.STEP_4_DETAILS_6: Create Client: Navigate to Realm > Go to "Clients" > Click "Create client"
SETUP.STEP_4_DETAILS_7: Fill Client: Client ID (e.g., my-app), Client Protocol: openid-connect > Click "Next"
SETUP.STEP_4_DETAILS_8: Configure Capabilities: Enable Client authentication, Authorization, Standard Flow, Direct Access Grants > Click "Next"
SETUP.STEP_4_DETAILS_9: Configure URLs: Root URL, Home URL, Valid redirect URIs > Click "Save"
SETUP.STEP_4_DETAILS_10: Get Client Secret: Go to "Clients" > Select client > "Credentials" tab > Copy "Client Secret"
SETUP.SCREENSHOTS_TIP: Click on each image to view it in full size. Follow the red highlighted areas for visual guidance.
SETUP.PRO_TIP_1: After setup is complete, you can view API details at the /docs page
SETUP.PRO_TIP_2: Code examples are provided for both Backend (Spring Boot) and Frontend (Angular)
SETUP.PRO_TIP_3: If you encounter errors, check the console logs or Keycloak Admin Console
SETUP.PRO_TIP_4: Refresh token automatically every 5 minutes - no additional configuration needed
SETUP.IMAGE_CAPTION_1: üì∏ Step 5: Click "Manage realms" at top left, then click "Create realm" button
SETUP.IMAGE_CAPTION_2: üì∏ Step 5: Enter realm name (e.g., ApplicationRealm), then click "Create"
SETUP.IMAGE_CAPTION_4: üì∏ Step 6: Navigate to "Clients" section in left sidebar, click "Create client"
SETUP.IMAGE_CAPTION_5: üì∏ Step 7: Fill Client ID (my-app) and Protocol (openid-connect), click "Next"
SETUP.IMAGE_CAPTION_6: üì∏ Step 7: Client General Settings - Confirm Client ID and Protocol
SETUP.IMAGE_CAPTION_7: üì∏ Step 8: Enable Client authentication, Authorization, Standard Flow, Direct Access Grants
SETUP.IMAGE_CAPTION_8:
üì∏ Step 9: Configure Login Settings URLs:
    Root URL: ${authBaseUrl}
    Home URL: /realms/{your-Realm}/{your-client-ID}/
    Valid redirect URIs: /realms/{your-Realm}/{your-client-ID}/*
    Then click "Save"
SETUP.IMAGE_CAPTION_9: üì∏ Step 10: Go to "Credentials" tab and copy "Client Secret" value
SETUP.STEP_5_DETAILS_3: Set realm name, client ID, client secret
SETUP.STEP_6_DESC: Configure Spring Security with JWT and OAuth2
SETUP.STEP_6_DETAILS_1: Create SecurityConfig.java class in your config package
SETUP.STEP_6_DETAILS_2: Configure SecurityFilterChain bean for HTTP security and JWT validation
SETUP.STEP_6_DETAILS_3: Implement JwtAuthenticationConverter to extract roles from Keycloak tokens
SETUP.STEP_6_DETAILS_4: Enable method-level security with @EnableMethodSecurity for @PreAuthorize annotations
SETUP.STEP_7_DESC: Enable component scanning for Keycloak library classes
SETUP.STEP_7_DETAILS_1: Open your main application class (Application.java or main class)
SETUP.STEP_7_DETAILS_3: Include 'org.ldang.keycloack' package for Keycloak library components
SETUP.STEP_7_DETAILS_4: Include your application package (e.g., 'com.example.test') for Spring Boot scanning
SETUP.IMAGE_CAPTION_10: üì∏ Step 11: Add @ComponentScan annotation to your main Application class
SETUP.STEP_8_DESC: Inject KeyCloakService into your Spring components
SETUP.STEP_8_DETAILS_1: Use @Autowired annotation to inject KeyCloakService in your controllers or services

FUNCTION_DETAILS.LOGIN_LONG_DESC: Authenticate username and password, returns access_token (for API calls) and refresh_token (for renewal). Access token expires after 5 minutes, refresh token after 7 days.
FUNCTION_DETAILS.REFRESHTOKEN_LONG_DESC: Use refresh_token to obtain a new access_token without re-entering password. Helps maintain continuous user session.
FUNCTION_DETAILS.LOGOUT_LONG_DESC: Invalidate refresh_token on Keycloak server. After logout, user cannot use refresh_token to get new tokens anymore.
FUNCTION_DETAILS.INTROSPECTTOKEN_LONG_DESC: Send token to Keycloak for verification. Server checks signature, expiration, and status. Returns detailed token information like username, roles, and exp time.
FUNCTION_DETAILS.DECODETOKEN_LONG_DESC: Only decode JWT without checking signature. Used to read information from token without needing to call API. WARNING: Do not use for security checks, only for reading information.
FUNCTION_DETAILS.REGISTER_LONG_DESC: Register new user in Keycloak. Two versions: register(request) to create user without assigning role, or register(request, role) to auto-assign role.
FUNCTION_DETAILS.GETUSERBYID_LONG_DESC: Query Keycloak to get full user profile including: name, email, roles, account status.
FUNCTION_DETAILS.UPDATEUSER_LONG_DESC: Edit user information like firstName, lastName, email. Admin can update any user, regular user can only update their own.
FUNCTION_DETAILS.RESETPASSWORD_LONG_DESC: Admin can set new password for user without knowing old password. Option to force user to change password on first login.
FUNCTION_DETAILS.CHANGEPASSWORD_LONG_DESC: User self-changes password by providing old password. Safer than reset password because old password must be verified.
FUNCTION_DETAILS.GETUSERBYUSERNAME_LONG_DESC: Retrieve full user profile by username including name, email, roles, and account status.
FUNCTION_DETAILS.ENABLEUSER_LONG_DESC: Re-enable a user account that was previously disabled. Enabled user can login and access resources.
FUNCTION_DETAILS.DISABLEUSER_LONG_DESC: Disable a user account without deleting it. Disabled user cannot login or access resources but account data is preserved.
FUNCTION_DETAILS.ENABLEUSERBYUSERNAME_LONG_DESC: Re-enable a disabled user account using username instead of ID.
FUNCTION_DETAILS.DISABLEUSERBYUSERNAME_LONG_DESC: Disable a user account using username instead of ID.
FUNCTION_DETAILS.UPDATEUSERBYUSERNAME_LONG_DESC: Update user profile information (email, name) using username instead of ID. Returns updated user information.
FUNCTION_DETAILS.ASSIGNREALMROLE_LONG_DESC: Assign global role (realm role) to user. Realm role applies to entire realm, not limited to specific app.
FUNCTION_DETAILS.USERHASREALMROLE_LONG_DESC: Check if user has a specific realm role. Returns boolean (true/false). Usually used to check permission before processing.
FUNCTION_DETAILS.GETALLROLESOFUSER_LONG_DESC: Get full list of all realm roles and client roles of user. Returns object containing realmRoles (list) and clientRoles (map).
FUNCTION_DETAILS.REMOVEREALMROLE_LONG_DESC: Remove a realm role from user. After that user will lose permissions related to that role.
FUNCTION_DETAILS.ASSIGNCLIENTROLE_LONG_DESC: Assign client-specific role to user. Client roles are scoped to particular client applications and not visible to other clients.
FUNCTION_DETAILS.REMOVECLIENTROLE_LONG_DESC: Revoke a previously assigned client-specific role from a user. Client roles are scoped to particular client applications.
FUNCTION_DETAILS.USERHASCLIENTROLE_LONG_DESC: Verify whether a user has a specific client-scoped role. Returns boolean indicating role assignment.
FUNCTION_DETAILS.GETREALMROLESOFUSER_LONG_DESC: Retrieve list of all realm-level roles assigned to a specific user. Realm roles are visible across all client applications.
FUNCTION_DETAILS.GETCLIENTROLESOFUSER_LONG_DESC: Retrieve list of all client-specific roles assigned to a user. Client roles are scoped to particular client applications.
FUNCTION_DETAILS.ISUSEREXIST_LONG_DESC: Check whether a user exists in the system by username. Returns boolean value.
FUNCTION_DETAILS.GETREALMROLEDATA_LONG_DESC: Retrieve detailed information about a specific realm role including name, description, and ID.
FUNCTION_DETAILS.LOGIN_WHEN_2: Need to authenticate username and password
FUNCTION_DETAILS.LOGIN_BEST_1: Always check response.isSuccess() before using data
FUNCTION_DETAILS.LOGIN_BEST_2: Save refresh_token in HTTP-only cookie (safer than localStorage)
FUNCTION_DETAILS.LOGIN_BEST_3: Store access_token in memory or sessionStorage
FUNCTION_DETAILS.LOGIN_BEST_4: Do not log password or token to console
FUNCTION_DETAILS.REFRESHTOKEN_WHEN_2: Before calling API if token is about to expire
FUNCTION_DETAILS.REFRESHTOKEN_BEST_1: Implement automatic token refresh before expiration
FUNCTION_DETAILS.REFRESHTOKEN_BEST_2: Have retry mechanism if refresh fails
FUNCTION_DETAILS.REFRESHTOKEN_BEST_3: If refresh token also expires ‚Üí force login again
FUNCTION_DETAILS.REFRESHTOKEN_BEST_4: Use HTTP Interceptor for automatic token refresh
FUNCTION_DETAILS.LOGOUT_BEST_1: Always delete tokens from client after logout
FUNCTION_DETAILS.LOGOUT_BEST_4: Log logout event for audit trail
FUNCTION_DETAILS.INTROSPECTTOKEN_WHEN_2: Check if token is still valid
FUNCTION_DETAILS.INTROSPECTTOKEN_WHEN_3: Get user information from token (username, roles)
FUNCTION_DETAILS.INTROSPECTTOKEN_BEST_1: Always validate token on server, not just on client
FUNCTION_DETAILS.INTROSPECTTOKEN_BEST_2: Cache introspection result for 5-10 minutes to reduce API calls
FUNCTION_DETAILS.INTROSPECTTOKEN_BEST_3: Check expiration time before using token
FUNCTION_DETAILS.DECODETOKEN_WHEN_4: Only for informational purposes, NOT for security
FUNCTION_DETAILS.DECODETOKEN_BEST_1: ‚ö†Ô∏è NEVER use decodeToken for security checks (always use introspectToken)
FUNCTION_DETAILS.DECODETOKEN_BEST_2: To validate signature and expiration, must use introspectToken
FUNCTION_DETAILS.DECODETOKEN_BEST_3: Hackers can create fake tokens if you only decode without validation
FUNCTION_DETAILS.DECODETOKEN_BEST_4: Only use for reading display information, not for authorization
FUNCTION_DETAILS.REGISTER_WHEN_2: Admin create account for other user
FUNCTION_DETAILS.REGISTER_BEST_1: Validate password on client before sending
FUNCTION_DETAILS.REGISTER_BEST_3: Assign default role "user" to new user
FUNCTION_DETAILS.REGISTER_BEST_5: Check if username/email already exists first
FUNCTION_DETAILS.UPDATEUSER_WHEN_3: Batch update user from CSV import
FUNCTION_DETAILS.UPDATEUSER_BEST_2: Check permission: only user or admin can edit
FUNCTION_DETAILS.RESETPASSWORD_WHEN_1: Admin reset password for forgot user
FUNCTION_DETAILS.RESETPASSWORD_WHEN_2: Force user to change password on first login
FUNCTION_DETAILS.RESETPASSWORD_BEST_1: Only admin can call this function
FUNCTION_DETAILS.RESETPASSWORD_BEST_3: Log who reset password for whom
FUNCTION_DETAILS.RESETPASSWORD_BEST_5: If temporary=true, user must change password immediately
FUNCTION_DETAILS.CHANGEPASSWORD_WHEN_1: User wants to change own password
FUNCTION_DETAILS.CHANGEPASSWORD_BEST_2: New password must be different from old password
FUNCTION_DETAILS.CHANGEPASSWORD_BEST_5: Logout all old sessions after password change
FUNCTION_DETAILS.ASSIGNREALMROLE_BEST_3: Log who assigns role to whom
FUNCTION_DETAILS.ASSIGNREALMROLE_BEST_4: Do not assign admin role to new users
FUNCTION_DETAILS.USERHASREALMROLE_WHEN_1: Check permission before handling admin action
FUNCTION_DETAILS.USERHASREALMROLE_BEST_1: Always check role on server, not just client
FUNCTION_DETAILS.USERHASREALMROLE_BEST_2: Do not cache result too long (max 5-10 minutes)
FUNCTION_DETAILS.USERHASREALMROLE_BEST_4: Check role from token, do not trust client
FUNCTION_DETAILS.GETALLROLESOFUSER_WHEN_1: Get all user permissions to display
FUNCTION_DETAILS.GETALLROLESOFUSER_BEST_3: Do not expose all roles to client
FUNCTION_DETAILS.REMOVEREALMROLE_WHEN_1: Admin revokes admin role from user
FUNCTION_DETAILS.REMOVEREALMROLE_BEST_2: Log who removes role from whom
FUNCTION_DETAILS.REMOVEREALMROLE_BEST_4: If removing admin role, invalidate existing sessions
FUNCTION_DETAILS.ASSIGNCLIENTROLE_WHEN_1: Assign editor role to content manager
FUNCTION_DETAILS.ASSIGNCLIENTROLE_WHEN_2: Give viewer role to guest users
FUNCTION_DETAILS.ASSIGNCLIENTROLE_BEST_1: Only admin can assign client roles
FUNCTION_DETAILS.ASSIGNCLIENTROLE_BEST_4: Use client roles for app-specific permissions
FUNCTION_DETAILS.GETUSERBYUSERNAME_WHEN_1: Search user by username instead of ID
FUNCTION_DETAILS.GETUSERBYUSERNAME_WHEN_2: Find user before sending friend request
FUNCTION_DETAILS.GETUSERBYUSERNAME_BEST_3: Use getUserById if you have the ID
FUNCTION_DETAILS.GETUSERBYUSERNAME_BEST_4: Sanitize username input to prevent injection
FUNCTION_DETAILS.ENABLEUSER_BEST_2: Send notification to user when enabled
FUNCTION_DETAILS.DISABLEUSER_BEST_4: Check for pending transactions before disabling
FUNCTION_DETAILS.ENABLEUSERBYUSERNAME_WHEN_1: Enable user when username is available
FUNCTION_DETAILS.DISABLEUSERBYUSERNAME_WHEN_1: Disable user when username is available
FUNCTION_DETAILS.UPDATEUSERBYUSERNAME_WHEN_1: Update user when username is available
FUNCTION_DETAILS.UPDATEUSERBYUSERNAME_BEST_2: Use updateUser with ID for better performance
FUNCTION_DETAILS.USERHASCLIENTROLE_WHEN_1: Check editor permission before showing edit UI
FUNCTION_DETAILS.USERHASCLIENTROLE_WHEN_2: Verify viewer role before displaying content
FUNCTION_DETAILS.USERHASCLIENTROLE_BEST_1: Cache role checks for same user
FUNCTION_DETAILS.USERHASCLIENTROLE_BEST_3: Check multiple roles for complex permissions
FUNCTION_DETAILS.GETREALMROLESOFUSER_WHEN_1: Display user roles in admin panel
FUNCTION_DETAILS.GETCLIENTROLESOFUSER_WHEN_1: Show all client-specific roles in admin panel
FUNCTION_DETAILS.GETCLIENTROLESOFUSER_BEST_2: Group roles by client in UI
FUNCTION_DETAILS.ISUSEREXIST_WHEN_2: Check if user exists in email recovery
FUNCTION_DETAILS.GETREALMROLEDATA_WHEN_1: Display role information in admin panel
FUNCTION_DETAILS.GETREALMROLEDATA_BEST_4: Use role ID instead of name for performance

TOKEN_INVALID: Refresh token is invalid or expired
UNKNOWN_ERROR: Token is not a valid JWT
VALIDATION_ERROR: Email/username invalid or password too weak
SOLUTION_USER_NOT_FOUND: Create user first or use a different username
SOLUTION_UNKNOWN_ERROR: Check token format, use introspectToken instead
SOLUTION_VALIDATION_ERROR: Check email format, password must have: UPPERCASE, lowercase, number, special character
SOLUTION_DUPLICATE: Use different username/email or find old user
SOLUTION_NOT_FOUND_REALM_ROLE: Create role first or check role name
